title: How can a high school student make money? - Quora

response.answer_text: I used to make good money in highschool. You can always recycle for a few extra bucks, your school should be a good start. I was also lucky enough to have parents that could afford to give me an allowance, but I did have a long regular lists of chores that if I didn't complete something, I didn't get paid. I don't just mean for that chore, i mean I didn't get any of my allowance until everything was done and done rite. But in highschool your expenses just keep piling in, so I had started my own simple handyman yard care business. It only took a few flyers in the rite locations, a couple neighbors I knew that could use the cheap labor and then I let my work do the rest. As soon as I had a couple houses a day(say 2 to 5hrs) for 5 to 6 days a week I took down the flyers and I was making a cool 100 to 200 a week cash in my pocket. I would take on jobs I knew I could handle, and only people that let me use there tools and lawn equipment. That way I didn't have to haul them or come outta pocket to replace any tools. Some of my loyal regulars were only an every other week job but it would be 6 to 8 hrs every other week, and I charged most people then $5 an hour. I believe minimum wage was 5.75, maybe 6.25 at the time so I was cheap but I worked hard, efficiently and nonstop. The people at the every other week job liked me so much that they gave me a raise to I think like $8 an hour so I was making like 50 to 120 a month just off them. Just remember that while having a job is great experience and shows maturity in you at such a young age, you need to never let work or making money get in the way of school, your education and earning your diploma is most important. Your only job as a kid is to really go to school and learn. Don't take that lightly because you will only go as far as what you know In this life. Yes I did graduate, from a decent highschool, with a graduating class of 5000 students, maintained a 3.31 GPA while lettering 4 years for the schools nationally recognized baseball program and held down the yard business for 2.5 years until I graduated and went to a local community college in the area. So just use your youth and imagination and you will find some decent ways to make some dollars. Work hard while you can and good luck to you!

I love it! It makes me feel so excited when someone is interested in making money so young. While others are thinking about getting wasted and get girls, there are some smart ones trying to be a few steps forwards. When I was in high school, I wasn’t popular at all. I was considered good looking and in good shape but other friends had more luck with girls than me. It wasn’t because I was not good with girls, it was because I wasn’t that focused on that. Of course, I wanted to get laid but I also wanted to make a lot of money and make all the girls come to me and beg for my time. While others spent their free time in the common area socializing, I used to spend my free time at the computers figuring out ways to make money, create websites, learn, etc. Believe me! Just by the fact that you are making this question, you are already making a big difference and you have an advantage among other people on your age. What You Focus Expands! Remember that, because if you focus on creating a business and making money you will do it sooner or later. Now, before you jump directly on whatever anyone else here is recommending you to do. I will tell you something I wish someone would have told me when I was in high school: Create an audience. That’s the first thing you have to do, build your audience because if you build an audience you can sell or create anything and you will already have someone to sell it to. Find something you are passionate about and create content about that topic: cars, gadgets, books, travel, makeup, clothes, food, whatever you want that you like and that you could talk about for hours. Create a Youtube channel, Instagram account, Twitter, Facebook page, Pinterest and post original content about the topic you like. I would suggest YOUTUBE because creating videos is original and provides value by the content you share, plus Youtube Partner Program will pay you for the views. Look at this kid: A 7-year-old boy is making $22 million a year on YouTube reviewing toys He makes $22 million talking about toys that he likes. Do you think you can do the same? If a 7-year-old kid can do it, I am sure you can do it. In fact, everyone can do it.  Then why not everyone is doing this? Why not everyone is making millions? Simple! Because people want everything fast, here, right now. They don’t want to work making 100 videos earning $0 and waiting until they get some views. No, they want to make one video and suddenly become famous and millionaire. And that’s not very likely. It can happen but usually, it doesn’t. What you can always count on, it’s that if you take action every day and you are patient you will get it. So, let’s go back! BUILD an audience. Provide content and once you have the audience you will be able to sell them whatever you want related to your niche. When I started building my audience I thought “I will make one hundred videos if I have at least 100 views per month in each one of them (which is very low), I will have 10,000 views”. “Mmm, it’s not enough. Then I will make 500 videos and expect 1000 views in each one of them. Then I will have 500,000 views! That’s a bigger number, I can do something good with that.” The truth is that I have videos with 5 million views and I only have 99,000 subscribers and barely 100 videos. But hey, now I have sponsors and Youtube pays me per views and I have an audience listening what I recommend or say to them. I can recommend a product and get commissions from every sale. So, my recommendation is to start a Youtube channel and an Instagram account. Use them to provide content and earn followers or subscribers. If you start now, and you upload content every week, you will start making money in less than a year because of the Youtube Partner Program. If you upload content more often you grow faster. The best part is that you don’t need money or investment to start doing this. If you have a webcam or a smartphone you can use it to record videos. You don’t know what kind of content? The kid was reviewing toys. You can review products you use or you like. SIMPLE! After you build your audience, a whole new world of possibilities to create income will open for you. Good luck! Be the candy man. I was the candy man in high school. Made great money. $100 day almost. Carried around a duffle bag full of candy in one half and my books on the other. Go to Sams club and buy packs of popular candy such as skittles, m&m, extremes, honey buns, etc., they should be on average around $5 a box of 12. That’s $7 profit if you sell everything for $1 which you should. Don’t make it $1.35 because nobody in high school carries change. Everybody has a dollar or can get a dollar. NEVER give out any freebee’s, IOU’s, or “I’ll pay you later”. Money upfront or no candy, plain and simple. Not even to your best friends. This is a business, be about your money. Discounts: It’s up to you if you want to do a sale where you lower your prices. One reason you may want to is to get rid of old inventory. Maybe you’ve had the last bit of candy you’ve been trying to get rid of and nobody has bought in the last couple days. You could do a $.50 flash sale to get rid of your inventory so you can re-up your stock with new supply. (I rarely did this. I usually just stuck to my guns and kept everything at a dollar.) Once or twice I’ve had smushed honey buns or big texas’ that nobody really wanted that I would let go for .50/.75. Only carry what you need. If you carry EVERY piece of candy you have, and your not 100% on top of your stash at all times, you WILL get robbed. Keep the rest at home or, if you know you’ll need more within the day, keep it in your locker. (Another note, Dont locker share! Don’t give out your locker combo, EVER!) School Rules: For The life of me and my entrepreneur mindset, I to this day still don’t know why the school system frowns upon entrepreneurship. In many schools it is against the “rules” to sell candy to other students. Why you may ask? I have no clue. The school sells candy though. Idiots. I remember I was on my way to the cafeteria one day to get ready for a field trip. I stopped by my friends class (also my partner at the time) to give him some inventory to sell off. The security lady saw us and said stop right there. Give me the candy. Part of me wanted to run but I knew better lol. She said give it to me or we can go to the principles office. In hindsight, I should have gone to the principles office because I never saw that candy again. She claims she threw it away…. Yeah right. The Lessoned learned was money can be losses but are you really gonna get in trouble for selling candy? And if you do, would your parents really be mad about that? If I could do it over again I would choose detention over giving up my stash every time. There’s still other students you can sell candy to in detention and you get to get out of class haha! Accounting Books: Keep track of how much you spend on inventory and how much you get back. By the count of how many pieces of candy you have total, you should know exactly how much cash you should have. If you didn’t do any sales and the numbers aren’t adding up then where did that money go? Also don’t keep all of the money you make in your pockets all day long. Professional pick picketers start off in high school lol. Put in your locker and never come to school with money. If someone ask for change tell them to come back after a class or two when youve made some sales. The money you get, make sure to keep it in a secure place, like a hidden pocket in your bag or a pocket on your clothes that zips up. People WILL try to rob you. Be smart! Biggest RULE!! DONT SPEND THE MONEY YOU MAKE!! If you go spending the money you made today to go buy some extra snacks at lunch, or go buy some cool toy that you won’t use a year later, you’re losing money you can use for better things. Would you want to see $100 or would you want to see $1,000? Would you want to hold $1,000 or would you want to hold $2,000? Learn from my mistake. I spent all that money, which I now realize was almost a full time income on stupid things that I now no longer use. They were fun but they didn’t make me any money and I ended up being broke…. Again. Goal: what’s your goal? Are you just trying to make some extra money to have money to spend on stuff? Are you trying to raise money to buy or pay for something specific? Or are you trying to start a business which will keep making you good money? If you don’t have something specific that you’re raising money for, I recommend saving EVERY last dollar you make and invest ALL of it into something that’s going to make you even more money than what selling candy makes you. Thats entirely another topic to get into for another time. It’s much easier to start a business when you are still a dependent with no bills and your parents are taking care of you. (Besides credit, again, another topic) If starting your own business appeals to you, think about becoming an entrepreneur. You can still go to school, get a degree and start a career, and you can still start your own business and fire your boss and not ever use your degree again. Depends on what you want in life and how you want to live. If so, once you start making money and you have your first $1,000 saved, look into other ways to make money. Just a few examples a lot of young people can get into are: Shopify, Amazon, YouTube, clothing brands, etc. Find what appeals to you, what you think you could do on a regular basis and what you would need to start AND become successful. Always do research. Good luck. If you follow this guide I promise you can make $100 a day.

Trust me there is no easy way to money, If someone tells you a certain website pays you something like clicking ads or surveys or anything which can be done quickly and easily, take it straight away as a scam. However it’s not completely impossible to earn money easily online or offline. Let me start by explaining what is money: In the ancient times when there was no money people used to trade something they had for a thing they wanted which somebody else had. for example- a fisherman would trade fishes he caught for the grain a farmer grew. As a person had limited time and energy as well as skill to do a certain work he/she would do excess of that work and barter the products to other people. moral: it is the time and energy people trade for the things they want. the Money or bucks which came later into existence as the civilizations grew and became a way to store the value of time and energy you spent to be used later, which made life easier. Now the fisherman mentioned above could sell his fishes for money to be used later to purchase something else to a trader who in turn will sell the fishes in a market for some extra profit. moral: the fish trader used money to work for him without having to catch fishes. Thus money made markets, and markets made life easier. You must be thinking.Stop your blabbering and tell me How do I earn money!! In fact i have answered your question. If you want to make money Think how can you make somebody’s life easier with whatever skills or time you have to spend. the formula goes like this Time = money, and Skill* time = (the rarity of skill * money) This applies to the whole world, why does a CEO of Google earns millions working for the same no. of hours compared to an average guy at McDonald's. It is because the skill that these CEO’s possess is very rare and has come to them with practice and patience. Let me simplify this, with the example of same fisherman, He has been working hard and catching fishes daily and selling them for money enough to buy him grains. this way he has to work everyday, one day he got sick and couldn’t catch any fish. that day he had to go hungry. This taught him an important lesson that if he continues to catch the same no. of fishes and got sick for a week he would starve to death. so he used his mind for planning ahead, and didn’t catch fish one day and went hungry, however with whatever energy he had left he made a net to catch more fishes the next day. Now he was able to catch more fishes and sold them for more profits, he saved this money and bought a canoe, now he could go deeper into the river and catch bigger fishes. He became a Millionaire later on. The Net in the story is not just a net its an asset. An asset is something which earns money for you. Let me tell you how you can build your own nets or assets, But a word of caution, Its a hard work to create an asset which could earn sufficient money for you. But YES IT CAN BE DONE. Some Assets you can create with very less or no investment except for Time and sweat. A blog : ever wondered how many times you have searched for something very obvious like “ How to make money” on Google and came across a post telling you how to. Then you have already encountered a blog. and the moment you clicked on that blog post someone out there earned money. Obviously they take a small amount as commission after you make a sale but you still retain 60–70% of the earnings with you. You just have to focus on writing a good story that people may want to read.There are other options as well but pretty investment heavy. You can contact me anytime and i’ll feel happy to help. First of all, good on you for working on your financial situation at such a young age. Keep it up and it will get you quite far. Now let’s answer your question. Since you’re so young, I’ll just assume that you are quite tech-savvy and familiar with social media and everything digital. That’s one of the best tickets for your success. Digital Marketing Number One. Learn online marketing. Essentially it doesn’t take too much time to learn how to market something really well. For example, you can learn social media management and try some collateral pages in order to make them go super popular. There are tons of educational material on the web, like on Udemy and Skillshare. The great thing about this is that you won’t have to sit at an office all day and most of the employers look for young people in these positions, so you have a nice advantage there. Once you practice on your accounts save them for your portfolio and then start freelancing. Freelancing is as easy as it gets these days. You can just sign up on Fiverr or UpWork. But make sure to have a nice profile, with relevant information. Like your education, some certificates, the work you’ve done and your skills. Some of these websites actually offer you test so that you can increase your credibility, take them. All in all, within a few months you’ll have learned digital marketing established a nice profile and also a good portfolio for a beginner. Dog Walking This is a super easy field. It doesn’t require any skills or experience. All you have to do is love dogs and be an outside person. There are numerous apps that make it possible to find potential clients in your area. Clients who don’t have enough time to walk their dogs themselves, so you can offer your services after school. At first, the pay isn’t going to be much, but the more dogs you walk in a day the more you’ll make. I think it’s easy to make like $20 an hour with this hustle. You can use apps like Wig! and Swifto, to find potential clients. however, this may prove unreachable as most of these apps are US exclusive. If you’re outside of the US, use your marketing skills that I mentioned earlier and grab some clients yourself. It’ll build up your portfolio even more. E-Commerce You can also make an online shop. It doesn’t even have to be a website, you can just create it on multiple platforms, even on Facebook. Make sure to research what platforms are mostly visited in your country and try to establish it there. So how does E-Commerce work? it’s pretty much like re-selling stuff you buy in a bunch from abroad. It could also be something that you’ve made yourself, but it needs to be relevant. For example, you can just buy a bunch of similar items from Alibaba, have it shipped to your location and sell it for a profit. You’ll also find the marketing skills handy that we’ve already talked about. Writing If you know English very well, you can become a freelance writer. It doesn’t require too much time to get into it. You just sit there, write some articles, then review them and catch some mistakes which you can improve immediately. Usually, people pay per article, which could be about 1,000 words. If the topic is new to you it would take you 2 hours maximum to do the research and write it. Usually, when writing freelance, it helps you get in touch with Keyword research. This is very important for your marketing skills down the line as good Keywords mean that Google is going to pay attention to you. If you get an order for an article that the client will use for their blog, make sure to implement some keywords. For example, the topic is about how chocolate is made. Some keywords would be: How is dark chocolate made? How is milk chocolate made? How chocolate is made step by step. These are connected to the same idea but are the words that someone may type in the Google search. Get good at writing and keyword research and you’ll become one successful writer. Hope I was able to help you with some examples. Keep the attitude you have now and you’ll definitely have some form of success. Stay awesome!

This probably isn’t going to be the answer you want to hear but it is truthfully a very easy way to earns one money. Go out and get a job at your local grocery store. “But why a grocery store?” you ask. And to that I tell you that grocery stores are great for a couple of reasons. The first more applies to the question and that is because tons of teenagers work at grocery stores, meaning that they have a lot of employees who have very specific times they can work. This works great for you because due to having so many employees, you can tell them when you want to and don’t want to work and it will generally be okay. Another reason? It’s VERY easy to get recognition for your hard work. In a group of teenage employees, you won’t find much effort and excitement for work, so your hard work will stand out, get you noticed by management, and possibly even promoted. “But how do you know that these are possibilities?” I know that both of those things are easily achievable because I have done them. When I first started working at a grocery store, I pushed carts in the dead of winter for six hours a night. Eventually my hard work outside was noticed and I was brought in to do some bagging and stocking inside, and eventually that got me to the point that I was offered a position in another department, one that is comprised of all full time adults, aside from me, a teenager who showed enough competence to work alongside adults and provide value. I’ve been able to earn a lot of money, friends, and experience through this, and I strongly suggest you go about it this way as well until you can figure out what you want. Best of luck!

Tutor: If you are good at any subject(s) in high school, you can definitely tutor your peers, lower class students. I had a friend who was so great at Computer Science, he was known in my entire school for that to an extent that even the teachers would ask him to tutor their child and he actually did that for $10/hour.Do people’s homework. You can suggest doing your classmates’ homework for them. But you gotta be careful to make sure it doesn’t look like your own and that the person who’s homework you’re doing is a big mouth or else you’ll get into trouble with the teachers and the deans.Sell snacks. I remember my friends would by a bunch of types of chips packs, keep them in their sports bags and then sell them for $1 each. Not bad considering a pack of 20 of those chips bags would cost around $10, so you’d get your money back and make profit.Internships: Even while in high school you can definitely get an internship. Talk to a career counselor and see if your high school has such opportunities. If not in high school, they will likely know of some opportunities outside. Never hurts to ask, or simply google.Part time job: You can definitely find a part time work opportunity around your school area. At a grocery store or a food restaurant. Employers will be likely to accept youngsters like you with no experience or degree necessary.

Source: Benjamin Robert Hello Statistic shows that there will be an increase of fees every year in school across the state and It's our dream that students should learn how to make money by staying comfortably in their schools Following are 10 ways you can make money online at the comfort of your school environment 1. Selling on eBay There have been many successful people that have made a very nice living selling on eBay. There have also been numerous people that have turned it into a part time job with a full time income. All you need is a way to get products that will sell on eBay and an account with eBay to sell them with. 2. Selling on Amazon Amazon is very popular, but much different than eBay. They don't charge you when you list an item, but they charge more than eBay when that item sells. However, this is sometimes the best way to get started for new people that want to sell online. 3. MLM Schemes Even though many people think that MLM is a scam there are a ton of people that have made a lot of money with MLM. It is not easy, but if you stick with it and you follow the program you can easily make some really nice cash with MLM. 4. Owning your own website If you have a hobby you love you could start your own blog or website. Then, all you have to do is sell products on it or sell advertisement. There are many ways you can monetize a blog and if it is your hobby there are probably many others that are also doing it. 5. Buying and Selling Websites There are a few options and this is why this is included in the 10 ways to make money online. You can build and sell websites for a profit or you can buy websites, build up an income with them, then sell them for a profits. Having a domain name and a website that makes any amount of cash is an investment and is like online real estate. They hold a specific value and you can make a lot of money with this option. 6. Affiliate marketing You can also advertise other people's products and collect a commission for every sale you make. This is one of the most popular ways to make money online. 7. Article Marketing A very good free way to get into affiliate marketing is by writing articles to drive traffic to websites that sell products for other people. Again you will collect a commission for each sale you generate. 8. Using Google AdSense If you would rather not sell products to earn money you can also use Google AdSense to run relevant ads on your website. Then, if anybody clicks on these ads you will get paid a commission by Google for your hard work. 9. Selling on Craigslist and other Free Classified Sites There is still a lot of money to be made through the free classified ad sites like Craigslist. If you have a product or can get a product you can sell it on Craigslist in your area or in another area of the country. There are a lot of people that use Craigslist and make a full time income from it. 10. Writing for a Living There are also many websites that will pay you for well written articles and stories. If you are at talented writer you can get paid as much as $3 for 100 words and more. This can be very lucrative if you can type and write a few articles each day. Hope it helps, I also wrote a bit about How To Make Money Online By Writing Articles on my blog here:STUDENT CAN MONEY ONLINE

There are a few ways to do this. The easiest way is to find a job. Plan a budget, and put X amount to the side toward your car. When you have enough, take the money out (or use debit) and get your car.Start an Online Business. The fastest way is to combine options 1 and 2. Get a part time job, budget your paychecks. Put X amount towards an online business (make sure you will have time to concentrate on school, your job, and your business BEFORE doing this). This method will not only give you the money for your car quicker than options 1 and 2 alone, but you will also be building a residual income for yourself that you can use to help pay for college or do it full-time after high school as your career.When I was in school, I had a part-time job in a supermarket. But I didn't know there was such a thing as online businesses. The internet was still relatively new and I didn't use the computer much (the connection was…dial-up). Otherwise I probably would have gone into online business earlier, but that's me. I tried a lot of different ventures, including a franchise and 2 MLM's. As I said above, if you're interested in online business, only choose option 3 if you can manage all the work hours between a part-time job and your business and still be able to concentrate on school. A cars a cool thing to have, and setting up residual income through your own business is exciting; but don't jeopordize your education for cool and exciting. You may not realize it today, but 10yrs from now you will see how important that education is. Trust me on this one. Thank you for the A2A.

Selling coke.  Pictured above is the boat loads of sugar you’ll find in a can of coke. When I was in high school, the only canned beverages the cafeteria sold were iced tea or juice (e.g., Brisk). Not only that, but the price was exorbitant! 2 dollars for one can… So I realized there was a lot of free market space for me to start a “business”. I asked my parents to buy me a pack of 24 cans of coke, and started selling them at lunch for 1 dollar each. People were getting an incredibly good deal: a drink they like way more than the drinks at the cafeteria, for half the price. I didn’t spread the word around too much, not only because I was kinda shy, but also because all “financial activities” were prohibited by the school’s code of conduct. Still, even with that, I was making a nice profit at 60 cents per can sold, which was enough for me to drink a can of coke each day and still be making money. If I didn’t fear the code of conduct so much, I could have rapidly up-scaled my coke empire and started making 50 to 100 dollars per week, if not more. After all, the demand for sugar is pretty damn high amongst high school students, seeing as they have so little self control.

Making money is not easy, simple yes if you know the skills but easy don't let anyone try and tell you it is because that is total B.S.  Listen, when I was in highschool I had 2 jobs, I worked at a video rental store called Blockbuster and sold shoes at Payless.  Both checks helped me through highschool for prom expenses and helping out my parents with food and living expenses.  Now that I know what I know now that I am a entrepreneur I will share with you some ideas on possible ways to make money on the internet. The internet is your gateway earning from a few hundred dollars a month to earning thousands per month. It is possible to make $5 per month if you work extremely hardEasily get screened out in the middle of the surveyLose all rewards after expiration durationIt does not allow you to make a sustainable income. I graduated as an engineer and after years of working 9-to-5, I got fed up with the routine work and decided to do something else that could earn me an opportunity to spend quality time with my family and make extra cash. I started as a blogger and expected to make some extra cash like anyone else. To my surprise, it turned out well where I made more money than what I could as an engineer. My preferred way is to become an affiliate marketer because it allows me to make a lucrative and sustainable income through blogging. You can easily make $300 - $500 per day by becoming an affiliate marketer. To make money from blogging (affiliate marketing), First, you need to find your niche. A niche means a target or a subject that you are going to write about. A niche can be your interest, a hobby or a skill. Any subject can be your niche, for example, people blog about collecting match boxes, bug photography, work-out program, or even daily political scandals and etc. Remember one thing is when you are finding your niche, avoid being too broad with your selection. For example, do not blog about Work Out Tips and Motorbike at the same time. Both of them fall on different categories and they just can't simply be put together. You could do a post about your niche (e.g. camera, guitar, trekking) and include affiliate links to any paid ones (e.g. Amazon or ShareASale). Create great content is not enough to make a lucrative income online today. You will have to make use of social media platform to promote your content and drive traffic to purchase items via your product reviews. My site earned my $7,000 within six months. Of course, I worked extremely hard at the beginning and success did not happen overnight. I spent almost 5 hours per day after work to make it worked. As my site matures, I spend 1 to 2 hours every day writing, optimizing my site, connect to social media and reply readers' emails. The best thing is the earning potential doesn't stop there and the revenue growth is still climbing up every single day (provided I publish articles regularly). At the time of writing, my site is making 5-figure revenue every month. Anyway, my answer is if you're passionate about a subject and you have decent writing skills, blogging definitely could be an alternative career path for you to make a living. All you need is to become an affiliate marketer. You will also find the pros and cons working as an affiliate marketer. Pros:The earning potential is enormous due to the exponential growth of the internet usersIt allows you to make sustainable income onlineIt allows you to quit your nine-to-five job and allow you to spend quality time with your familiesIt is a legitimate online businessThere are many affiliate programs on the internet you can participate (e.g. Amazon, ShareASale, Apple, FreeflyVR)Cons:It requires a lot of effort and timeYou need to blog from time to time (constantly publish content)You need to learn how to do affiliate marketingYou can’t do it alone. It requires mentor-ship. However, it is still possible for a newbie to make a sustainable income online by choosing the right niche. For example, everyone is talking about virtual reality now. If you are interested in VR and you blog about, I believe there will be a huge potential in making good money from it. Note: Freefly VR offers affiliate program to earn commission. So, my answer to your question - become a blogger/ affiliate marketer. Hope the answer helps. Regards Alex Founder of ManagingYourFinance.Com

I remember a fellow student selling full size candy bars when I was in high school. He would buy them wholesale and sell them for less than what the vending machines were. Some kids want to go to a party and tell their parents that they are really visiting a friend somewhere, you could offer to pretend that you are that trusted parent of someone calls to check in. Then there are all of the legit businesses that anyone can start. Just don't get into drug dealing at school. All of the idiots trying to sell drugs at school make a couple dollars, then think that they are Pablo Escobar. My entrepreneurial high school friends that thought this was a good idea ended up getting hurt and/or in serious legal trouble. When I was in eighth grade all the schools in my district took out the vending machines because of all the new “healthy” rules. That meant no more caffeine unless you brought it from home. So, I took cans of mt dew to school and sold them for a dollar each. It doesn’t sound like a lot but let me explain the operation. Walmart and other stores have 12 packs of Mountain Dew on sale, 3 cases for 12 dollars. I would sell all thirty six in a week or less when I started. That’s 24 dollars profit. When I came close to running out I would stock up again, and sell them all quick. I made pretty good money for a 14 year old. Not as much as a actual job would pay but just some pocket money. You can also cut grass, shovel snow, rake leaves. One of my friends used to make over a hundred dollars a week just on grass. If you are old enough you can just get an actual job. Fast food is always hiring but there are sometimes better jobs. Dishwashing at nursing homes, Walmart pays well, so does target.

Hello! You can both study and work as a freelancer: 1. TOPTAL  Toptal is mostly for freelancers that have a lot of work under their belt. There is a screening process that needs to be completed and passed in order to gain access to great clients with substantive projects along with competitive compensation. The community of Toptal freelancers holds unique technological events and community gatherings. Do know that Toptal only accepts the top 3% of applicants who are tested and interviewed, making their pool of talent highly valuable. 2. PEOPLE PER HOUR  Aimed at web projects for marketers, SEO specialists, and software engineers, People Per Hour works to streamline the process of freelancing by organizing communication and payments as well as job management. Freelancers can send 15 proposals to clients for free before they will need to sign up for a paid plan, but freelancers can browse jobs and get notified for new openings at no cost. It is worth checking out for those who are focused on completing any type of web focused project. 3. UPWORK  This site boasts over 1.5 million clients, and there are jobs for every type of freelancer that you could imagine that last short term and long term. Work can be done as hourly or per project, and anyone whose skill level is entry level to expert can find something that fits their need. Because of the vast availability of work, it is likely that anyone can find work through this platform. When work is completed, funds are safely transferred from client to freelancer. These are TOP-3 sites from the Internet, I personally used to work on Upwork, it’s nice for students, yeah.

Find somebody you trust and that’ll trust you and transfer that money from paypal to their card and withdraw your money. If you’re in high school you probably have cheap expenses. Babysitting is an option for girls - it can pay very well. People are more hesitant to hire males for babysitting, unfortunately, and that isn’t likely to change due to us living in a world full of bad people. For boys: cutting grass, landscaping, weeding. A unique option would be to offer a service for walking dogs or petsitting, which would apply to both genders. Other options applying to both genders include tutoring a subject you are good at (math, English?), editing/reviewing homework and term papers (just don’t help the student cheat by overediting or doing it for them), house cleaning, car detailing, or garage organization/cleaning. Of course, you could also just get a part time job anywhere (McDonalds, library, grocery store, etc), but the options I listed give you the opportunity to run your own little business, which is good for you: you’ll learn advertising, customer service, hard work, pride in your work, and many other useful skills. So, my recommendation, in short, is to offer your services in an area at which you are at least somewhat skilled and that you enjoy doing. Advertise your services, sell yourself at an interview, do a FANTASTIC job for your customers, follow up on customer complaints, and earn repeat business.
